alert.note: Alert for Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; San Joaquin River Canyon; South End of the Lower Sierra; Yosemite Valley (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued February 25 at 3:45PM PST until March 01 at 4:00PM PST by NWS Hanford
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM SUNDAY AFTERNOON THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON ABOVE 2000 FEET... ...WINTER STORM WARNING WILL EXPIRE AT 4 PM PST THIS AFTERNOON BELOW 8000 FEET... * WHAT...Heavy snow possible above 2000 feet. Total snow accumulations of 1 to 69 inches possible. Winds could gust as high as 40 mph. * WHERE...Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra, Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra, South End of the Lower Sierra, Yosemite Valley and San Joaquin River Canyon. * WHEN...For the Winter Storm Warning, until 4 PM PST this afternoon. For the Winter Storm Watch, from Sunday afternoon through Wednesday afternoon. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult to impossible. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute.
info.instruction: Monitor the latest forecasts for updates on this situation.

area.areaDesc: Fresno-Tulare Lower Sierra; Mariposa-Madera Lower Sierra; San Joaquin River Canyon; South End of the Lower Sierra; Yosemite Valley
